RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the department: United States Department of Homeland Security

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol: involved in the stop of RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR. and IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.; considered the behavior of vehicles' drivers in determining reasonable suspicion to stop; followed suspicious vehicles for approximately five minutes; conducted a roving stop; familiar with most vehicles on Farm-to-Market Road 2050; interacted with law enforcement during the traffic stop
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Department of Homeland Sec: received information regarding attempted alien smuggling events; conducted interviews at the Freer immigration checkpoint; involved in the prosecution of individuals and bears the burden of proving that stops were constitutional
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Officer Reymundo Reyes: conducted a traffic stop, noticed IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR. was extremely nervous; asked about contraband after searching for proof of insurance; questioned Defendant's travel plans and route taken from Laredo to Dallas via Interstate 35; informed Defendant that he wasn't going to allow the black Dodge pickup truck to continue to its destination
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Government: prohibits unreasonable searches and seizures, involved in the prosecution of individuals and bears the burden of proving that stops were constitutional; has a court system including the Fifth Circuit
